column1:
samuraiturtle,"2014-12-22T10:59:30.673Z","Time To Bug You","

I do not know why it is called a "Spider".  For one spiders have eight legs, this thing only has six legs.  At best it is some sort of "beetle".  I am guessing it is called a "spider" is because it is own by a "spider man" (no, not that guy).

For the build it is small (with only 40 pieces).  It should only take a couple minutes.  Plus their is some repetition with he legs /  mouth parts, but that is only eight times.  As for the accessories it come with one "Chima Crystal"  and two "guns" (which is not pictured on the front of the package, just the one "gun").  Speaking of "guns" attached to the "bug" they look like exhaust ports or mufflers, to me at least.

Why did I get this?  For one I wanted another "Spider Tribe Member" and no one else.  Second, it was only $4.  Third, I am thinking it is going to disappear soon.  I guess, I should tell you where I got this from a store called "Meijer".  (It is based out of the Great Lakes area.)

So if you like spiders or bugs and / or Chima, it is a good little set to get. I am not sure what kind of "special promotion" this set might of go with like a "holiday time sale".  (But, like I said earlier I do not think it will be around to much longer.  Six months max, I am guessing.  From the supplies I have seen.)

,TRUE,3,2,2,2,2 Odeinoichus","2016-06-09T17:37:11.26Z","Arachnophobia! Not Entirely.","

Set # 30263 Spider Crawler: Gotta love a polybag from LEGO that gives us a spider tribe Minifigure and a neat little mech vehicle build for you to enjoy. So let’s go on to the pros and cons of this one.

column2: Spider Crawler build is a fun and simple little build that works as a spider tribe speedy thief vehicle. I can see a load of these racing across the plains of Chima to snatch the Chi crystals from the Lion Tribe Temple. It also looks like a nice little spider mech too.

Sparratus minifigure is awesome, love the double-sided torso print with webbing armor and the leg printing, head piece is awesome too. Includes a single-sided facial print and a Chi crystal for accessory.
Also missing spider legs for Sparratus’ minifigure’s back.

column1: Overall this polybag is an awesome little stocking stuffer for the holidays if you haven’t picked it up, and makes for a great army builder set for making a small army of spider walker mechs to go with the larger Spider based vehicle. Highly recommended.
